titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Lee Stookey Papers WAG.350
titlestmt.author: Kate Fisher

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-03 11:44:50 -0400.

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

did.abstract: The Lee Stookey Papers contain documents recording Stookey's efforts to improve New York City public schools. A member of New York, New York's District 13 Community School Board she wrote a series of reports on public education based on her experiences.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Lee Stookey Papers contain documents recording Stookey's efforts to improve New York City public schools, including published reports on school food, education reform, and collective bargaining, as well as her notebooks of committee and Parent Teachers Association meeting notes from 1969 to 1980.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Lee Stookey, also known as Elizabeth Stookey, was elected to the District 13 community school board in 1975 and represented her district on the Community School Board Council on Collective Negotiations. The Community School Board Council on Collective Negotiations acts as a consultant to the New York Board of Education during contract negotiations with employee unions. She recorded her negotiating experience in a series of reports on public education from 1976 to 1978.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives has no information about copyright ownership for this collection and is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from it. Materials in this collection, which were created in 1969-1980, are expected to enter the public domain in 2089.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials found in repository; provenance is unknown. The papers are possibly a deaccession from the archives of Teachers College Library, Columbia University. The accession number associated with this collection is 2018.085.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Lee Stookey Papers; WAG 350; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: At the time of accessioning, the collection was rehoused in archival boxes and folders, transcribing original folder titles.
